value.title: PlayStation Inventor Starts New Career Making Robots for No Pay
value.excerpt: Ken Kutaragi, the legendary inventor of the PlayStation gaming console, is taking on one of the hardest jobs in robotics. And he’s getting paid nothing to do it.

value.title: Future Trends in Robotics Should Translate to More Upside for “UBOT”
value.excerpt: The robotics industry has proven its mettle amid the Covid-19 pandemic with machines taking the place of humans in order to stave off further infections from the virus. That said, a recent Robotics & Automation News article identified additional trends that can only further the expansion of the robotics industry--good news for ETFs like the Robotics & AI Bull 3X ETF  (NYSEArca: UBOT).

value.title: Enhanced computer vision, sensors raise manufacturing stakes for robots as a service
value.excerpt: Firms developing computer vision technology for standard robots, developments in 3D vision and so-called “Robots as a Service” are defining the next wave of automation.

value.title: Service Robotics Market to Reach USD 41.49 billion by 2027; Rising Usage in Healthcare & Logistics Sectors to Aid Growth: Fortune Business Insights™

value.title: 82% of people believe robots can support their mental health better than humans
value.excerpt: The COVID-19 pandemic has negatively affected the mental health of 78% of the global workforce, a report by Oracle and Workplace Intelligence finds.

value.title: How AI can help employees improve mental health and wellbeing
value.excerpt: The UAE, a hub for start-ups and venture capital in ... Nearly 60 per cent of local respondents said AI has improved job satisfaction and overall well-being, compared to 54 per cent globally. Robot security guards are on patrol at Abu Dhabi's largest ...

value.title: Robot reapers and AI: Just another day on the farm
value.excerpt: Technology is now enabling farmers to manage each section of the farm based on its unique conditions and needs. A good example of this in action is the spraying of herbicides, which had traditionally been done at the same rate across the whole field.

value.title: Dexterous robots are coming to the US Air Force
value.excerpt: The military branch has awarded a contract to a robotics firm to develop artificial intelligence-based dexterous robots.

value.title: Study Shows People Prefer Robot Over Their Boss: 6 Ways To Be A Leader People Prefer
value.excerpt: These are stressful times—among the most stressful in history—and people need help. Often, they turn to their employers and specifically their leaders. But they don’t always get what they need. A new global study reports people actually prefer robots to humans for help with mental health issues.

value.title: How Is Artificial Intelligence Revolutionising Our Global Healthcare?
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence is reinventing everything we once knew about healthcare. Find out how this technology could save millions of lives in the future. Artificial intelligence is one of the most promising technologies in the world.

value.title: AI researchers challenge a robot to ride a skateboard in simulation
value.excerpt: Nvidia AI researchers say they created a more energy efficient and effective way to make four-legged robots walk.

value.title: This robot fry chef on rails can be yours for $30,000
value.excerpt: The robot uses machine learning to identify foodstuff and a camera array (which includes a 3D depth-sensing cam from Intel and a thermal camera) to navigate its environment. A robotic arm then wields a spatula and grabs baskets full of food to fry.

value.title: GTC 2020 round-up: Nvidia announces virtual world for robots, AI video calls
value.excerpt: Nvidia's GPU Technology Conference, also known as GTC, is all about artificial intelligence. We'll give you a rundown of everything that was announced.

value.title: NVIDIA Jetson Nano 2GB is $59 gateway into AI and robotics

value.title: Combining AI and Nanotechnology to Create Robot-Assisted Molecular Manipulation
value.excerpt: A team of scientists from Forschungszentrum Jülich and TU Berlin is working on a project to create an autonomous artificial intelligence system with the ability to pick up and move individual molecules.

value.title: Bolstering Robotics Enterprise Potential using AI Applications
value.excerpt: Robots perform tasks like recognizing and grasping objects, automating its navigation and understanding human language with the unveiling of Artificial Intelligence (AI) applications in its system.

value.title: Landmark court decision says robots can’t be inventors. But the fight isn’t over
value.excerpt: The United Kingdom's highest court tossed out a case that would've established that machines can be creative and win patents for their inventions

value.title: Air Street Capital: AI industry remains strong despite academic brain drain, tech nationalization
value.excerpt: Air Street Capital's annual State of AI report finds that despite challenges, the AI industry remains strong heading into 2020.

value.title: Will We Go Back To Being Robots After Covid-19?
value.excerpt: When it comes to our professional lives, the best positive impact of the coronavirus is the way it has made business less robotic and more human. Will it stay that way?

value.title: How the pandemic has reshaped AI, robotics, and automation
value.excerpt: Tonya Hall talks with Dr. Kate Darling, research specialist at the MIT Media Lab, to learn more about how the future of AI, robotics, and automation was reshaped following the COVID-19 pandemic outbreak.

value.title: DeckRobot Raises $1.5 Million To Generate PowerPoint Slides Using AI
value.excerpt: Making professional, company-approved Powerpoint slides is difficult for the average employee. DeckRobot is an artificial intelligence add-on to Microsoft Office’s PowerPoint to all a user to create approvable slide decks in one click.

value.title: Executives Say Artificial Intelligence Will Boost Productivity; But Their Employees Aren’t So Sure
value.excerpt: For example, while 82 percent of executives see their companies bringing in robot and SI trainers over the next 15 years, compared to only 44 percent of employees. Business leaders see artificial intelligence as taking a prominent role within their organizations.

value.title: Elon Musk put a computer interface in a pig’s brain. Could future AI turn animals against us?
value.excerpt: It’s been a month since Elon Musk and Neuralink trotted out a cyborg pig to show off the company’s progress toward a brain computer interface (BCI). I still see Gertrude in my nightmares. The big idea behind Neuralink is the development of a brain implant that will allow everybody to control computers with their minds.

value.title: NeuroMaker STEM Announces Partnership with Vinci Robotics Academy
value.excerpt: NeuroMaker, the STEM education arm of Somerville based company BrainCo announces their partnership with Vinci Robotics Academy, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that operates STEAM educational programs in the greater Boston area.
